The annual pop-up village, arguably the top must-see attraction of winter in NYC, opens its doors this Saturday, October 27

Snow might not be in the forecast just yet, but winter is coming to Manhattan early this year! Starting on Saturday, October 27, and running through the New Year (January 2), the annual tradition known as the Winter Village at Bryant Park will set up shop over much of this beloved NYC green. There’s no shortage of festive fun to be had, from seasonal activities such as ice skating to perusing holiday markets consisting of some of the city’s top food and artisan vendors.

Unsure what makes this winter wonderland a “can’t miss” attraction for tourists and locals alike? The Manhattan Club has five reasons why your visit during winter in NYC should include a swing by Bryant Park!

Conquer the ice on NYC’s only admission free skating rink

The true centerpiece of the Village is the 17,000-square-foot rink, open daily through the season (weather permitting). Admission is free with skate rentals, reserved time slots, and other additional perks available for a small fee.

Finish procuring your holiday gift list early

With a multitude of different retail vendors from designer brands to unique holiday gifts, there’ll be something for everyone in this European-inspired open-air market.

Enjoy some festive foods

Interspersed in the custom-designed kiosks, amongst the retail vendors, is a delicious smorgasbord of food vendors with foods ranging from the most savory to the sweet!

Let the special events melt your heart

Come in for the tree lighting! Take part in a skate school! Join in with the New York City Opera Caroling!

Keep out of the cold!
